head.title: selector-type-no-unknown
head.description: selector-type-no-unknown Disallow unknown type selectors. The following patterns are considered warnings: The following patterns are not…

body:
#selector-type-no-unknown

Disallow unknown type selectors.

       input {}
/**    ↑
 * This type selector */

The following patterns are considered warnings:

unknown { }
uNkNoWn { }
UNKNOWN { }

The following patterns are not considered warnings:

input { }
iNpUt { }
INPUT { }
ul li { }
li > a { }

#Optional options

#ignoreTypes: ["array", "of", "types"]

Allow unknown type selectors.

For example, given:

["unknown"]

The following patterns are considered warnings:

tag
tAg
TAG

The following patterns are not considered warnings:

unknown { }
uNkNoWn { }
UNKNOWN { }
unknown > a { }
rawBody:
# selector-type-no-unknown

Disallow unknown type selectors.

```css
       input {}
/**    ↑
 * This type selector */
```

The following patterns are considered warnings:

```css
unknown { }
```

```css
uNkNoWn { }
```

```css
UNKNOWN { }
```

The following patterns are *not* considered warnings:

```css
input { }
```

```css
iNpUt { }
```

```css
INPUT { }
```

```css
ul li { }
```

```css
li > a { }
```

## Optional options

### `ignoreTypes: ["array", "of", "types"]`

Allow unknown type selectors.

For example, given:

```js
["unknown"]
```

The following patterns are considered warnings:

```css
tag
```

```css
tAg
```

```css
TAG
```

The following patterns are *not* considered warnings:

```css
unknown { }
```

```css
uNkNoWn { }
```

```css
UNKNOWN { }
```

```css
unknown > a { }
```
raw:
---
title: selector-type-no-unknown
---

# selector-type-no-unknown

Disallow unknown type selectors.

```css
       input {}
/**    ↑
 * This type selector */
```

The following patterns are considered warnings:

```css
unknown { }
```

```css
uNkNoWn { }
```

```css
UNKNOWN { }
```

The following patterns are *not* considered warnings:

```css
input { }
```

```css
iNpUt { }
```

```css
INPUT { }
```

```css
ul li { }
```

```css
li > a { }
```

## Optional options

### `ignoreTypes: ["array", "of", "types"]`

Allow unknown type selectors.

For example, given:

```js
["unknown"]
```

The following patterns are considered warnings:

```css
tag
```

```css
tAg
```

```css
TAG
```

The following patterns are *not* considered warnings:

```css
unknown { }
```

```css
uNkNoWn { }
```

```css
UNKNOWN { }
```

```css
unknown > a { }
```
